attributes.action: Repeal the powers contained in the recent (1/10/07) EU Statutory Instrument (Data Retention Directive) which allows almost unfettered access to everyone’s telephone, mobile data & future email data.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The government has allowed, & thus supported, the imposition of another EU directive which impinges upon the personal liberties of the general public from the 1st October 2007. Under this power, every interaction you have on every phone anywhere in the country, & future emails, must be logged, stored & made available to the Government. The information can be demanded by almost “officer of the government”, including but not limited to the following; any police officer, civil servant, public health officer, tax or even a parking officer. Making this type of personal & privileged information available on-mass is unnecessary and “Big Brother By The Back Door”, making the UK the most surveyed, monitored & watched society in the World.
